{"step_by_step_thinking": "The question is about a 10-year-old child presenting with a curved back. The most common cause of a curved back, or scoliosis, in a child of this age is idiopathic. Congenital causes are less common and would likely present with other signs of congenital malformation. Neurofibromatosis could cause scoliosis, but it would also present with other signs such as skin changes or neurological symptoms. Neuromuscular causes are also less common and would likely present with other signs of neuromuscular disease.", "answer_choice": "C"}
